metadata.source: IIT Delhi Official Academic Integrity Code

policy.title: IIT Delhi: Code of Conduct for Artificial Intelligence in Academic Work
policy.preamble: IIT Delhi is committed to academic excellence and integrity. This policy governs the use of AI tools while maintaining the highest standards of scholarly conduct.

definitions.artificial_intelligence: Software systems that can perform tasks that typically require human intelligence
definitions.ai_assistance: Using AI tools to enhance learning or improve work quality
definitions.unauthorized_ai_use: Submitting AI-generated work without proper acknowledgment
definitions.plagiarism: Presenting AI output as original work without modification or credit

examples: Using ChatGPT to explain complex theorems
Machine translation for reading foreign language papers

permitted_uses.details: Must show understanding of AI-generated code
examples: GitHub Copilot for code suggestions (with review)

permitted_uses.limitations: Must not change original meaning or ideas

prohibited_uses.violation: Submitting AI-generated text as original work
Copying AI output from other students
Hiding AI tool use from faculty

mandatory_for: All assignments where AI is used significantly (>20%)

academic_work.template: AI Tool: [Tool Name], Purpose: [What was done], Extent: [Percentage]

disclosure_requirements.example_statement: I used ChatGPT (OpenAI) for approximately 30% of this assignment, specifically for brainstorming ideas and improving paragraph clarity. All major arguments and code logic are my own work.

design_principles: Focus on understanding rather than just output
evaluation_guidelines: Assess student's ability to critique AI output
Look for evidence of original thinking
Use plagiarism detection tools (as aids only)
Have conversations with students about their work

requirements: Understand your course's AI policy (in syllabus)
Disclose AI use honestly and completely
Ensure AI output aligns with course objectives

resources.workshops: Monthly sessions on 'Responsible AI in Academics'
resources.appeal_process: Students can appeal through Dean of Students office
